page.title: 15Farming
page.content: Farming is the biggest industry in the block we have studied. Years ago the area was particularly known for its sheep, but although there are still a few flocks left most farms are now mainly arable growing barley and oats for animal feed, barley for malting and wheat for flour. Some farms have a few fattening bullocks and others have turkeys which they feed up for Christmas. Some of the farms have been in the same hands for generations,particularly Home Farm at Kineton and New Barn Farm in Temple Guiting. Many of the ancestors of the local villagers also used to work on the farms before mechanisation reduced the numbers needed to just one or two.
